sourcesContent:
import React, { Component } from 'react'; import { Card, CardTitle, CardBody, CardText, Button, Form, FormGroup, Input, Label, Col, Row } from 'reactstrap'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom' import { render } from 'react-dom'; import { Tabs, Tab, TabPanel, TabList} from 'react-web-tabs'; import { Control, LocalForm, Errors } from 'react-redux-form'; import "react-web-tabs/dist/react-web-tabs.css"; class Create extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props); this.state = { title: null, category: null, teamSize: null, description: null, languages: null, yearsOfExp: null, time: null, languages_friendly: null } this.handleChange = this.handleChange.bind(this); this.handleSubmit = this.handleSubmit.bind(this); this.handleSelectedMultiple = this.handleSelectedMultiple.bind(this); } handleChange(event) { console.log(event.target.name) const value = event.target.value; this.setState({ ...this.state, [event.target.name]: value }); } // languageChange(event) { // console.log(event.target.name) // const langarr = event.target.value; // const languages_friendly = langarr.toString(); // this.setState({ // ...this.state, // languages: langarr, // languages_friendly: languages_friendly // }) // } handleSelectedMultiple = evt => { const values = Array.from(evt.target.selectedOptions, option => option.value); // Or this way // const values = [...evt.target.selectedOptions].map(opt => opt.value) console.log('values', values); const languages_friendly = values.toString(); this.setState({languages: values, languages_friendly: languages_friendly}); }; handleSubmit(event) { this.props.postProject( this.state.title, this.state.category, this.state.teamSize, this.state.description, this.state.languages, this.state.yearsOfExp, this.state.time ); event.preventDefault(); } render() { return(

What Are We Building?

Name Category Description Languages Team Size Experience Weekly Time Commitment Review and Submit

Name

Use a short and simple name for your project. Don't worry you'll have more room to describe your project in the Description section.

Category

What category does your project best fit into? If you can't find one that matches your project, choose "Other"

Description

Here's where you can spill all the beans on what your master plan is. Give a thorough explanation of what you're trying to build and the expections of what you need from your team. Spare no detail!

Languages

Finely tune your team by picking the languages you're envisioning your project to be build with. Choose as many as you'd like.

Team Size

This one's pretty simple. How many team members do you need?

Experience

Some projects are harder than others. How many years of experience should your team members have?

Weekly Time Commitment

Setting expectations on time commitment is important from the start. How many hours a week should your team be spending on your project?

Review and Submit

Final check. Does everything look right? You can always click back and edit. When you're ready, create your project.

Name

{this.state.title}

Category

{this.state.category}

Description

{this.state.description}

Languages

{this.state.languages_friendly}

Team Size

{this.state.teamSize}

Experience

{this.state.yearsOfExp}

Weekly Time Commitment

{this.state.time}
{/* */} {/* this.handleSubmit(values)}>
*/} {/*
*/} {/* */}
) } } export default Create
